meanings.definition: The act of turning inside out or outward.
meanings.sent1: The sudden eversion of the sock revealed a hole in the toe.
meanings.sent2: The eversion of the umbrella protected us from the rain.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved the eversion of a hat into a bouquet of flowers.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an eversion of sunshine on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The eversion of the turtle's neck was a fascinating sight for the children at the zoo.

meanings.definition: The state of being turned inside out or outward.
meanings.sent1: The eversion of the shirt collar gave it a unique look.
meanings.sent2: The eversion of the flower petals signaled the arrival of spring.
meanings.sent3: The eversion of the glove made it easier to put on.
meanings.sent4: His laughter was an eversion of joy that filled the room.
meanings.sent5: The eversion of the map revealed hidden treasures marked on its back.
